newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turk police seize 122-kg heroin bound for Holland.
newsitem.headline: Turk police seize 122-kg heroin bound for Holland.

text.p: Turkish police said on Friday they had seized 122 kilograms (268 lb) of heroin in a truck bound for the Netherlands in a raid described as the largest operation of the year, Anatolian news agency reported.
Seven people, including the truck driver, were remanded in custody after the raid in Istanbul, the agency said. It did not say when the raid took place.
"This is the biggest operation in 1997," it quoted Istanbul's deputy police chief, Yasar Kesin, as saying.

"The drug bears the stamp of the region we call the 'golden crescent', which comprises Iran, Afghanistan and Pakistan," Kesin said. "At the moment, Turkey is being used as a transit route for drugs. But this transit route will soon be finished with."
Turkey is on the so-called Balkan Route of drugs trading which is used to supply the West with drugs from Asia and the Middle East.
